intro: Stichorkis habbemensis, commonly known as the Habbemense Stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and often milky sap. The plant typically features erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
